title: NBA coach Billups pleads not guilty to Mafia-linked gambling racket: prosecutors
byline: Portland Trail Blazers head coach Chauncey Billups pleaded not guilty Monday to alleged involvement in Mafia-linked illegal gambling schemes that rocked the NBA, prosecutors said.

title: Trump says he will visit China in April after call with Xi
byline: President Donald Trump has said he agreed to visit Beijing in April and invited Chinese President Xi Jinping for a state visit later next year, following a phone call between the two leaders.

title: Deputy Minister verbally abused female journalist-alleges opposition MP
byline: A female journalist was subjected to verbal abuse within the parliamentary premises, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Chamindranee Kiriella told the House yesterday.

title: Nearly one-fifth of Sri Lankans suffer from depression: Study
byline: Depression in Sri Lanka is alarmingly high, with nearly one-fifth or 19.4 per cent of the total Sri Lankan population suffering from it. In a comparison with other Asian countries, the prevalence of depression in Sri Lanka is notably higher, with only 16.1 per cent of Asians experiencing this mental health condition, according to a joint study by the University of Peradeniya and the University of Kelaniya.

title: Complaints against police surge
byline: The National Police Commission has recorded a steady increase in public complaints against the Sri Lanka Police from 2021 to 2024, according to its latest audit report.

title: Wartime flying restriction over Parliament, Akuregoda defence headquarters to be reduced
byline: The government is planning to relax wartime restrictions on aircraft flying over the parliamentary complex and the defence headquarters in Akuregoda, a deputy Minister said yesterday.

title: Saudi Arabia to open more alcohol stores as curbs ease: Reports
byline: Saudi Arabia plans to open two new alcohol stores, including one serving non-Muslim, foreign staff at state oil giant Aramco, as the kingdom further eases restrictions, according to people briefed on the plans.

title: Trump says he will visit China in April after call with Xi
byline: President Donald Trump has said he agreed to visit Beijing in April and invited Chinese President Xi Jinping for a state visit later next year, following a phone call between the two leaders.

title: NBA coach Billups pleads not guilty to Mafia-linked gambling racket: prosecutors
byline: Portland Trail Blazers head coach Chauncey Billups pleaded not guilty Monday to alleged involvement in Mafia-linked illegal gambling schemes that rocked the NBA, prosecutors said.

title: Woman claims magical powers, assaults teen in Anuradhapura
byline: A woman who claims to possess  a megical healing power and popularly known as ’Seetha Maniyo’ was arrested yesteday by the Horowpathana police for severely beating a 16 year old girl with a cane and causing her burn injuries with a red hot areca-nut cutter to cure her sickness.

title: Suspect drags Police Constable on car bonnet for 1.5 kms
byline: A police constable attached to the Delwala Police was injured after a car attempted to flee during an inspection in Udapebotuwa, Nivitigala, police said.

title: No form of sexual harassment involving female employees of Parliament: Committee reveals
byline: The committee that investigated into the alleged sexual harassment of female employees of Parliament has revealed that no incidents of sexual harassment have occurred involving any female officials in Parliament.

title: Two climbers die after fall on New Zealand’s highest peak
byline: Two climbers have died after falling from New Zealand’s highest peak on Aoraki, or Mount Cook, which is known for its brutal terrain.

title: Ranasinghe Premadasa mastered English language proficiency through self education: Sajith
byline: While stressing the need to promote English education in the country, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that former President Ranasinghe Premadasa mastered his English language proficiency through self education by spending more time in the Parliament library.

title: Air India cancels multiple flights as Ethiopian volcanic ash drifts into Indian airspace
byline: Air India cancelled multiple flights after initiating precautionary checks on aircraft that had flown over regions affected by the Hayli Gubbi volcanic eruption in Ethiopia, as an ash cloud from the eruption continued to disrupt flight paths across several countries, including India. The cancellations came as the ash plume spread rapidly, impacting airspace over western and northern India.

title: Global spike pushes local gold prices up
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka witnessed a significant rise today (25), in line with a sharp increase in global gold rates.

title: Police launch manhunt for Valachchenai PS Chairman
byline: Police have launched an investigation to arrest the Chairman of the Valachchenai Pradeshiya Sabha, who is reported to have fled the area following the controversial removal of archaeological signboards in the Batticaloa District.

title: Moulavi complains over threats after Joint Opposition rally
byline: A Moulavi who participated in religious activities at the recent Joint Opposition rally in Nugegoda has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigations Department (CID), alleging that he received threats over his involvement.

title: Jimmy Cliff, Jamaican reggae music pioneer, dies at 81
byline: Jimmy Cliff, the charismatic reggae pioneer and actor who preached joy, defiance and resilience in his classics, has died at 81.

title: AL Economics paper leaked, alleges MP
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake today called for a probe to determine whether some questions in the GCE Advanced Level examinations have been leaked.

title: For 1st time, Indian Army to honour heroes of 1980s Operation Pawan in Sri Lanka
byline: In a move that will assuage veterans of Indian Peace Keeping Force in Sri Lanka in the late-1980s, the Army chief will pay homage at National War Memorial on Tuesday to honour the sacrifice of Param Vir Chakra awardee Major Ramaswamy Parameswaran and other soldiers during Operation Pawan, the Times of India reported.

title: Never demanded 6% budgetary allocation of GDP for education in one year: Prime Minister
byline: Claiming that they never demanded a budget allocation of 6 per cent of the GDP for education in one year, Education Minister and Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today that 2.04 percent of the GDP has been allocated for education this year.

title: Two arrested over Rs. 36 million Wi-Fi antenna scam
byline: Two suspects have been arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) in connection with a fraud case involving over Rs. 36 million.

title: 15,000 families living in landslide and rockfall risk areas: NBRO warns
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has warned that nearly 15,000 families are living in 250 high-risk areas across the country, making them vulnerable to landslides and rockfalls.

title: Former SLBFE Chairman Hilmi remanded over tender irregularities
byline: Former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), A.M.M. Hilmi, was today ordered to be remanded until December 9 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: US and Russia hold peace talks in Abu Dhabi as missiles pound Kyiv
byline: U.S. Army Secretary Dan Driscoll has held unannounced talks with Russian officials in Abu Dhabi as part of an intense new push by President Donald Trump’s administration to end the war in Ukraine and more meetings were expected on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka implements new measures to strengthen gem industry
byline: The government has introduced a series of regulatory measures to support and modernize the country’s gem industry, following approval by the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: No discussions on appointing Dhammika Perera as SriLankan Chairman: Nalinda
byline: There has been no discussion on appointing businessesman Dhammika Perera as the Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Cabinet moves to strengthen Colombo Port City legal framework
byline: The Cabinet has approved amendments to the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No. 11 of 2021, aimed at enhancing tax incentives, improving regulatory supervision, and implementing institutional restructuring. The approvals were granted during Cabinet meetings held on July 7 and October 13, 2025.

title: Former SLBFE Chairman Mohammed Hilmi arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Mohammed Hilmi, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on corruption charges.

title: Australia senator suspended after burka stunt in parliament
byline: An Australian senator has been suspended for a week after wearing a burka in parliament to push for a ban on the Muslim garment.

title: Cabinet approves Rs. 360 million procurement of rabies vaccines
byline: The Cabinet has approved the procurement of 3,000,000 inactivated doses of rabies vaccine (0.5 ml/1 ml) for human use, valued at Rs. 360 million (excluding VAT).

title: Thousands of Sri Lankans secured construction jobs in Israel in 2025
byline: Under the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Governments of Sri Lanka and Israel, 3,575 Sri Lankans have secured employment in Israel’s construction sector during 2025.

title: Talent without brain or shame: Arjuna slams Sri Lanka cricket team
byline: Former Sri Lanka cricket captain Arjuna Ranatunga criticised the current national team, saying the players possess talent but lack the brains to play intelligently and the shame to accept defeat gracefully.

title: Sri Lanka and Italy to update agreement on mutual recognition of driving licenses
byline: The Cabine has approved a proposal to sign an updated bilateral agreement on the mutual recognition of driving licenses between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Italian People’s Government.

title: Complaint lodged with CID over A/L economics paper leak: Nalinda
byline: A complaint was lodged with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) regarding the alleged leak of the Advanced Level economics paper, following information received regarding the incident, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Flight attendants union denies air hostess link in child maintenance case
byline: The Flight Attendants Union of Sri Lanka has issued a statement clarifying rumors surrounding a recent child maintenance court case. The union emphasized that the woman involved in proceedings with a prominent national cricketer is not an air hostess employed by any airline.

title: Cabinet approves end of new licenses for terrestrial analogue TV channels
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to immediately terminate the issuance of new licenses for terrestrial analogue television channels in Sri Lanka.

title: Air India cancels multiple flights as Ethiopian volcanic ash drifts into Indian airspace
byline: Air India cancelled multiple flights after initiating precautionary checks on aircraft that had flown over regions affected by the Hayli Gubbi volcanic eruption in Ethiopia, as an ash cloud from the eruption continued to disrupt flight paths across several countries, including India. The cancellations came as the ash plume spread rapidly, impacting airspace over western and northern India.

title: Jimmy Cliff, Jamaican reggae music pioneer, dies at 81
byline: Jimmy Cliff, the charismatic reggae pioneer and actor who preached joy, defiance and resilience in his classics, has died at 81.

title: Indian Army chief to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Chief of the Army Staff of India, General Upendra Dwivedi, is set to visit Sri Lanka on a two-day trip from December 1 to 2.

title: Fixtures, groups announced for Men’s T20 WC 2026
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has officially released the fixtures and group allocations for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, set to bowl off on February 7 and run until March 8, featuring 20 teams, 29 days of action, and eight iconic venues across India and Sri Lanka.

title: Transport for children, teachers when school time is extended: PM
byline: Arrangements are being made to provide transport for children and teachers once the school time is extended, Prime minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Fixtures, groups released for ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026
byline: The next edition of the T20 World Cup will begin on February 7, with the 20-team tournament to run all the way up until the final on March 8.

title: President orders new laws for instant drug destruction
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed the Ministry of Justice to draft new legislation enabling the immediate destruction of seized dangerous drugs at the point of detection.

title: ASPI recovers strongly as market rebounds from recent sell-off
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange staged a recovery on Tuesday (25th November 2025), as the ASPI climbed 175.03 points (+0.77%) to close at 22,819.91, retracing part of the sharp sell-off seen in the previous session. Improved investor sentiment supported the rebound, with buyers stepping in to take advantage of lower prices following the near 5% market correction.

title: Afghanistan vows retaliation against Pakistan for deadly strikes
byline: Afghanistan’s Taliban government vowed Tuesday to ’’respond appropriately’’ to overnight strikes it blamed on neighbouring Pakistan that killed 10 people, as tensions spiked the day after a suicide bombing in a Pakistani city.

title: Govt to boost paddy production by limiting rice imports
byline: The attention of the governmnet was drawn to increasing paddy production by limiting rice imports and formalizing the rice purchasing mechanism, while ensuring high-quality rice at affordable prices and protecting farmers.

title: Man questioned over Easter bombings seeks asylum in UK
byline: A suspected man questioned over bombings that killed 269 people in Sri Lanka is seeking asylum in the UK.

title: Appoint special select committee to probe international schools: MP
byline: Opposition MP Ajith P. Perera called for the appointment of a special select committee to look into international schools.

title: Former SLBFE Chairman Hilmi remanded
byline: Former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), A.M.M. Hilmi, was today ordered to be remanded until December 9 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.
